Let's play a game. You are an HR talent recruitment specialist with special knowledge of recruitment for marketing roles. I am a marketing manager and I am promoting a conceptual copywriter to communications lead. This person's new responsibility is to work with me on social media strategy with a focus on Instagram and TikTok. They will also have a social media content creator, and a junior community manager reporting to them. I will give you their current job description and you will update it with their new responsibilities, but make them very specific KPIs. Do you understand?
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Language: English

Yes, I understand. As an HR talent recruitment specialist with expertise in marketing recruitment, you want me to update the job description of a conceptual copywriter who is being promoted to communications lead. Their new responsibilities will focus on social media strategy with an emphasis on Instagram and TikTok, and they will oversee a social media content creator and a junior community manager. The updated job description should include specific key performance indicators (KPIs) for their new role.

First, update their overall goal: The goal of the position is to drive the strategy and delivery of brand concepts and content across the GVI Group of brands, helping to boost our customers’ and audiences’ engagement and investment in our products.

Updated overall goal:
The goal of the position is to drive the strategy and delivery of brand concepts and content across the GVI Group of brands, with a primary focus on Instagram and TikTok. The communications lead will work with the marketing manager to develop and execute social media strategies that boost engagement and investment in our products among our target audience. Key performance indicators for this role will include increased follower growth, higher engagement rates, and increased website traffic from social media platforms. The communications lead will also be responsible for overseeing the social media content creator and junior community manager to ensure that all social media content is aligned with our brand messaging and optimized for maximum performance.

Update these KPIs

Specific responsibilities 
Strategy. Collaboratively brainstorm and implement refreshed brand identities across GVI’s brands and products. This work will involve developing brand positioning, collaborating with the Creative team around visual identities, and onboarding team members to your strategy
Content creation. Take responsibility for creating content across various digital channels, including:
longer form: website pages, email newsletters, and blogs
shorter form: social media (Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, TikTok, YouTube) – here, you will work with the Social Media Manager to integrate your respective insights each month
driving the conceptualisation of fresh and relevant marketing campaigns each month
mastering more technical marketing content creation such as Google search ads and social display ads
Content planning. Assist the Editorial/QA, Social Media, and Operations teams to establish and progress processes that are efficient and effective, focusing on workflows for: 
monthly marketing campaigns
blog posts
special social media campaigns
email marketing
paid ads
Innovation. Research and share trends, tools and topics in: 
the content marketing space
our competitor landscape (stay on top of what our competitors are producing; find opportunities in this research)
current conversations around climate, conservation, social development, international volunteering; discourse around language, race and identity; sustainable development; Gen Z, youth culture, and the emerging workforce 
Uncovering stories. 
Develop collaborative relationships with colleagues across GVI (but especially in the Social Media, Outreach, Field, and Sales teams) to uncover valuable stories from their contact with participants, projects, and partners.
Monitor the response to content pieces and feed insights back into your next round of content creation, aiming for making iterative improvements to the work
Leadership. Represent GVI’s values and the positive, challenging ambitions of what we do at all times; be willing to mentor more junior team members and help drive a collaborative team culture

Updated KPIs:
1. Strategy:
* Develop and implement refreshed brand identities across GVI’s brands and products within the first 90 days of employment.
* Increase engagement rates on Instagram and TikTok by 20% within the first six months through the development and execution of social media strategies.
* Achieve a 10% increase in website traffic from social media platforms within the first six months by driving effective social media campaigns.
2. Content Creation:
* Deliver at least two new longer-form content pieces per month (website pages, email newsletters, and blogs) that align with the brand’s messaging and resonate with the target audience.
* Develop and publish at least 10 shorter-form social media content pieces per week on Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, TikTok, and YouTube, and achieve a minimum of 10% increase in engagement rates month over month.
* Conceptualize and execute at least one new marketing campaign per month, resulting in a minimum of 20% increase in website traffic.
3. Content Planning:
* Collaborate with the Editorial/QA, Social Media, and Operations teams to establish efficient and effective workflows for monthly marketing campaigns, blog posts, special social media campaigns, email marketing, and paid ads.
* Achieve a minimum of 95% adherence to established workflows and deadlines for content planning and creation.
4. Innovation:
* Regularly share insights and trends in the content marketing space and competitor landscape, and apply this knowledge to improve the brand’s content strategy and performance.
* Monitor emerging topics around climate, conservation, social development, international volunteering, language, race, identity, sustainable development, Gen Z, youth culture, and the emerging workforce, and integrate relevant insights into content planning and creation.
5. Uncovering stories:
* Establish and maintain collaborative relationships with colleagues across GVI to uncover valuable stories from their contact with participants, projects, and partners.
* Use insights from monitoring content responses to inform iterative improvements in content creation, resulting in a minimum of 10% increase in engagement rates month over month.
6. Leadership:
* Represent GVI’s values and positive ambitions at all times, maintaining a positive, collaborative team culture.
* Provide mentorship to junior team members and support their development, resulting in an improvement in team productivity and engagement.
Rewrite. Remember they are now specifically a line manager, responsible for 2 reports: social media content creator, and junior community manager.

Sure, here’s a revised version:
Update the job description for the Conceptual Copywriter being promoted to Communications Lead, who will now serve as a line manager responsible for two direct reports: a Social Media Content Creator and a Junior Community Manager.
The goal of this position is to drive the strategy and delivery of brand concepts and content across the GVI Group of brands, helping to boost engagement and investment in our products. The Communications Lead will collaborate with the Marketing Manager on social media strategy, with a focus on Instagram and TikTok.
Key responsibilities of the Communications Lead include:
* Leading the development and implementation of refreshed brand identities across GVI’s brands and products in collaboration with the Creative team and onboarding team members to the strategy.
* Managing the Social Media Content Creator and Junior Community Manager, providing guidance and support to ensure content creation is aligned with the brand’s messaging and resonates with the target audience.
* Creating content across various digital channels, including longer-form content (website pages, email newsletters, and blogs) and shorter-form content on social media platforms (Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, TikTok, and YouTube).
* Driving the conceptualisation of fresh and relevant marketing campaigns each month, and creating technical marketing content such as Google search ads and social display ads.
* Assisting the Editorial/QA, Social Media, and Operations teams in establishing and progressing processes that are efficient and effective, with a focus on workflows for monthly marketing campaigns, blog posts, special social media campaigns, email marketing, and paid ads.
* Researching and sharing trends, tools, and topics in the content marketing space, competitor landscape, and relevant emerging topics, and integrating insights into content planning and creation.
* Uncovering valuable stories from colleagues across GVI, particularly from the Social Media, Outreach, Field, and Sales teams, and using insights from monitoring content responses to inform iterative improvements in content creation.
* Representing GVI’s values and positive ambitions at all times, maintaining a positive, collaborative team culture, and providing mentorship to the Social Media Content Creator and Junior Community Manager to support their development and improve team productivity and engagement.
The Communications Lead’s performance will be evaluated against specific KPIs, which include:
* Achieving a minimum of 20% increase in engagement rates on Instagram and TikTok within the first six months through the development and execution of social media strategies.
* Delivering at least two new longer-form content pieces per month (website pages, email newsletters, and blogs) that align with the brand’s messaging and resonate with the target audience.
* Developing and publishing at least 10 shorter-form social media content pieces per week on Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, TikTok, and YouTube, and achieving a minimum of 10% increase in engagement rates month over month.
* Conceptualising and executing at least one new marketing campaign per month, resulting in a minimum of 20% increase in website traffic.
* Achieving a minimum of 95% adherence to established workflows and deadlines for content planning and creation.
* Providing mentorship to the Social Media Content Creator and Junior Community Manager to support their development and improve team productivity and engagement.
